intro: Elephantopus bodinieri, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
